title: Queued with four man quad queue, they pick an ADC top and stick me in DPS Bot. So I choose Malzahar.

This is untrue in lower ELO unfortunately. We bronzes apparently like to think we know all the best builds and that others should be sticking to exactly that build. I guess this is really an exaggeration, as it has only happened to me maybe 50 times out of my 1000 games, but it is still irritating when it does happen. Probably not the best place to bring this up either...

Um.

What MrBuffington said!

Graves, like quinn, is a great top choice. He's a counter for a lot of bruisers up there.  Your job as bot, in most scenarios including this one, are to be an ADC and a support. This means you were essentially trolling and griefing. EVEN if you don't see it that way.

Crappy answer. Just because it is *meta* to have an Attack Damage Carry (which is what ADC stands for, since no one seems to be using it correctly) in the bottom lane, does not mean it's necessary. And if you already have 3 AD champions on your team, instead of making a FOURTH AD CHAMPION, it's always better to just pull out an AP champ - such as {{champion:90}} or {{champion:8}} - and to farm up and wait for ganks, that way the whole other team doesn't just build thornmails and blow you up.

TL;DR   :    If you are a carry, who uses Attack Damage *to* carry, then you are an AD Carry. 3 ADC's already? Pick an AP.

also {{champion:69}}  and  {{champion:17}}  are two ap champ that loves to be botlane if they are full ad in the other lane, one just farm stack more safely with a sup to protect her while the other just blind the enemy for maximum ragequit :p
Holy trying to play against these two is just death. Teemo's poison works wonders with Cass' Twin Fangs, so she can just spam it as long as teemo is auto attacking the same person.

Many times LCS teams do full ad comps - this is a viable strategy. It is usually better to follow the meta. Plus, Graves top usually doesn't build the same things as Graves ADC, so there would be a need for raw damage.

I don't think OP deserves to be reported though.

Full AD is a viable strategy, but the OP's strategy was equally viable. Look at Froggen often picking Anivia, who hasn't been a meta favorite for a long time. He is great with her, and it makes sense to choose her rather than a FotM champ he isn't as skilled with.

Personally, I never ADC and would probably do better as Malz bot than trying to pick up an ADC on the fly.

[It's not league, but it still fits here] Last year's Smite world championships was a fantastic example; Serquet was broken on the patch they played, so she was 100% ban for the first, like, 10 games. Then one team let her through the bans and first picked her and proceeded to go something like 0/6. It happened the exact same way again a couple games later and all of a sudden Serquet went from 100% pick/ban to 0% pick/ban in the same tounament. 

There's a huge argument for comfort picks over meta picks.

My problem with taking an ADC in two slots is that ADCs are built to be babysat. They need protection and the watchful eye of allies who can lockdown and isolate targets while the sustained damage of ADCs does it's thing. ADCs build almost zero defensive stats and are the first player targeted in general. So if you have two ADCs, you are losing out on the lockdown and defensive capabilities of a Mage or a Bruiser or a Tank and creating a need to babysit TWO players instead of one.

So, if I can prevent this problem by choosing a champ that retains team composition even if it doesn't meet community meta of lane assignment, why is that not better?
It's not taking an adc into two spots. It's viable strat. Downvote me all you want. The OP was just as troll/toxic as they were.

Not playing the common "meta" of a marksman bottom is NOT trolling nor toxic. The OP's point was that a full AD comp is easily countered, and that he was unfairly flamed (not that there's such thing as fair flaming) for playing a champion that actually could have worked well with his team composition if his teammates had been more willing to work with him. Anything is viable, and it's ironic that you're saying that he's trolling for not following the other player's strategy by creating his own strategy.
If you say so...

Riot says so.

No matter how often you report someone for off-meta picks, they will not be punished.  Picking off meta is not trolling, it is not toxic.  It is simply picking off-meta.  The meta being something created by the players, there are no rules enforcing the meta, you can break it all you want and suffer no consequences from Riot.

The fact everyone is saying "You should just blindly follow the meta crusade because if you don't then it's your fault you get flamed!" gives me brain cancer.

You know how many times I go Orianna Support Bot? Kindred Mid? Morgana/Karma Mid and Support fuckin Ahri? And still win?

Pls stop being a bunch of brain-dead followers.

Plus, his reasoning is solid. If you have all AD, spread out your damage, yes meta wins but off-meta wins too, children.

I am in full agreement, though strictly as a ~~sidetone~~ sidenote (I hate you, auto-correct!), Orianna support is something I saw so much of in Season 3 that I grew to hate her very existence. Then Season 4 came along and I basically never saw her again, even in mid. Not "flashy" enough for most people's tastes, I imagine.

My question is, why did you NOT go AD Malzahar? AD Malzahar isn't a trolling build, it's legitimately strong. Build Manamune w/ 40% CDR, maybe take Essence Reaver for that, then just spam all your spells like mad and summon 3+ voidlings to insta-gib any VIP they encounter. Gunblade or Rylai's could be a good mix-up, while still retaining your AD Malz shtick.

Split push all day if your team is retarded. Nobody can 1v1 a farmed &/or fed AD Malz, not unless they get a QSS, have Smite available to use, and have a lot of armor (even then, fat chance they will kill you, as you can just kite them around while simultaneously summoning legions of voidlings to widdle them away. Ka-ching, 250g, straight to the bank motherfucker). Also, I think AD Malzahar is literally the best pusher in the entire game. That isn't hyperbole. His voidlings kill towers at such an absurd rate that if you have 3 items, and the enemy team ignores you for as little as 5 minutes, you can take their inhibitor easy peasy, maybe even still their inhibitor tower if they send someone to stop you.

So, why get so mad at them asking you to be ADC? AD Malz is legitimate, and a lot of people don't know how to handle it. Hard counters include heavy-armor tanks or minion-murdering monstrosities, aka Malphite, Nasus, Rammus, etc.
It has nothing to do with weather OP thought AD Malzahar was bad or not. He just didn't want his teams damage to be all AD.
Well, that's fair I suppose.

Q: Are lol players too dumb to tell the difference between position and role?
A: Yes.

I think they're wrong, but still have a small point.

The role of ADC may mean to carry with Attack Damage, but the _real_ reason it exists is to take down towers.

Graves is terrible at this frankly, he's too short ranged. If you had something like Graves top, Lee Sin Jungle, and Yasuo mid, you really don't have much sieging ability. Thus, a typical ADC may have still been a good option (especially Corki). That said, you can't be expected to own and play every champion (I'm an ADC main and I don't own Corki, although I'm actually planning to purchase him soon).

Malzahar sounds like a reasonable choice there. I'm not sure how he does in lane against an ADC + Support but I'd imagine well. In general, in the situation where you need AP bot and Corki isn't an option, you want a mid laner who absolutely wrecks ADCs anyways. That way you can cheese win your lane, and still keep the good team comp.

Malzahar is actually a pretty excellent pusher, what with his ability to clear minion waves with a spell and constantly spawn voidlings. With the way AP damage is calculated against towers I'm willing to bet he's not much worse than other more meta choices at tower busting (like Ashe or Ezreal)

Anyway, thats not why his team had his hissy fit. OP could have picked Azir or Ziggs and gotten the same treatment. People by and large don't actually understand the meta, they just follow it.
You should see how people react when I pick Yasuo adc and we have a team like Vayne top, Orianna mid, and Nidalee jungle.
Yasuo ADC actually works surprisingly well. You just give up your siege, but if you have an ADC in another lane you don't have to worry about that.
Glad to see someone else does that. Me and my duo buddy are playing Janna/Yasuo almost exclusively and it's a blast every time.

That's coincidentally who I had as my support that game, and while she's fine, I prefer other supports. My actual favorite support to have when playing Yasuo adc is Leona. She has the tankiness and initiation needed to give me a clean opening, has the CC to lock them up long enough for my tornado, and the extra damage from her passive to help me get past my low damage early game. Braum is also another good one because you can proc his passive stun extremely quickly thanks to Q, he easily follow you in as well while making you tankier with W, and he can knock up enemies with his ult. Alistar is also another obvious good choice. I'm generally not a fan of the squishier supports unless they also happen to be aggressive laners like Sona or Nami that can make up for my lack of range with their own threat and provide reliable assistance in an all in.
